title: Rafael Nadal 'marries Mery 'Xisca' Perello in lavish Spanish wedding'
text:
Rafael Nadal marries Mery ‘Xisca’ Perello in Spain (Picture: Rex / Getty)

Rafael Nadal has ‘married Mery ‘Xisca’ Perello in a lavish wedding’ in Spain.

According to AFP, the tennis ace, 33, and insurance worker have finally tied the knot, after a 14-year relationship.

And the bride, 31, wore a stunning gown designed by Rosa Clara, on her big day.

Despite no official photographs being shared from the ceremony just yet, the designer shared a glimpse at her dress on Instagram, as she thanked the lovebirds for including her brand.

Alongside a video of showing the design process, she said: ‘An overwhelming wedding day for all of us! We feel incredibly proud for taking part in such an important day – Mery Perelló and Rafa Nadal’s wedding.

‘We would like to congratulate the gorgeous and unique couple, we wish you the best forever!’

Rafa and Mery have been together for 14 years (Picture: Getty)

Discussing the dress, Rosa explained it is ‘an exquisitely clean-lined haute couture design.

‘The bodice, with jewel neckline and long sleeves, was made of beautiful Art Deco-inspired French lace with delicate patterning, flower motifs and microbeading on the meticulously hand-embroidered fabric.

‘The ballgown-style skirt, made of silk crepe, featured a weightless detachable train, created in Rosa Clara’s Atelier.’

She added: ‘The whole process was full of emotions between all of us. We just want to thank the whole family for trusting in us, you’re extraordinary.’

Rafael and Mery said their “I Dos” at the stunning La Fortaleza, Spain’s most expensive property.

Well, if you’re going to get married, you might as well go all out…

And they were joined by royalty on the day, with former king of Spain Juan Carlos I leading the famous faces.

Tennis players Feliciano López and Juan Monaco were also seen making their way into the venue.

Thanks for the invite, huns.

And it turns out the Fortress is a popular wedding venue for other sports stars, as Gareth Bale married Emma Rhys-Jones there back in July.

Rafael and Mery have been dating for around 14 years, and got engaged back in May, 2018.

But, despite being one of the biggest sportsmen in the world, the Wimbledon champion has kept their romance largely out of the spotlight.

However, he opened up about the prospect of starting a family with Mery in the future, in a chat with Hello! Magazine.

Speaking about their future together, he said: ‘Obviously, I have the intention of forming a family.

‘I love children and I would like my children to do what they like.’

Mery is often on the sidelines watching Rafa play (Picture: Getty)

Mery has been a regular fixture at Rafael’s games in the past, but previously explained that she wouldn’t be following her beau around the world full-time anytime soon.

In a candid chat with The Telegraph, she said: ‘Travelling together everywhere, even if I could, would not be good either for him or for me.

‘He needs his space when he is competing, and just the idea of me hanging around waiting on his needs all day wears me out. It would asphyxiate me.

‘And then he would have to be worrying about me … No. If I followed him everywhere, I think there’s a risk we might stop getting along.’

Which is fair enough.

Metro.co.uk has contacted Nadal’s reps for a comment.
